physical_examinations.vital_signs: Vital signs were within normal limits on admission.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Large, ulcerative lesion in the left orbital area involving the left eye, significant necrosis, extensive tissue destruction with erythematous borders and macroscopic evidence of myiasis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial improvement in swelling and death of larvae after treatment, but subsequently developed a third-degree atrioventricular block and asystole post-surgery.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 7-cm ulcerative lesion in the left malar and orbital area with significant swelling, erythema, extensive necrosis, purulent secretion, and presence of multiple white larvae.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant improvement of the lesion after treatment with ivermectin followed by surgical debridement.
